definition: American TV series/abbr. for 美國電視劇|美国电视剧
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: When Donald Trump watches The Walking Dead, he thinks of us.
sentences.chinese: 川普看美剧《行尸走肉》的时候会想到我们。

sentences.english: The Atom is officially coming alive on Arrow.
sentences.chinese: 原子侠真的要出现在美剧《绿箭侠》中了。

sentences.english: Both shows return from holiday breaks in January.
sentences.chinese: 这两部美剧都将会在一月回归。

sentences.english: The response from the media and our viewers has been extremely gratifying.
sentences.chinese: 这部美剧不论是媒体还是观众的反响都非常棒。

sentences.english: 'The Walking Dead' will be back for a third season of zombie goodness.
sentences.chinese: 我们将能看到超好看丧尸美剧《形式走肉》的第三季。

sentences.english: If American shows were Coca-Cola, British dramas seem more like a cup of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 如果说美剧是可口可乐，那英剧则是一杯咖啡。

sentences.english: Last year, with no access to the Internet, I watched American dramas the whole day.
sentences.chinese: 去年，我在断网的春节里，看着无尽的美剧。

definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
Game of Thrones (TV series)/abbr. for 權力的遊戲|权力的游戏[Quan2 li4 de5 You2 xi4]
(neologism c. 2016) no tv shows to watch
Pride and prejudice, novel by Jane Austen 珍·奧斯汀|珍·奥斯汀
